Cleft soft palate.context: Cleft soft palate. Repair of cleft soft palate and excise accessory ear tag, right ear.

Repair of cleft soft palate.context: Cleft soft palate. Repair of cleft soft palate and excise accessory ear tag, right ear.

excise accessory ear tag.context: Cleft soft palate. Repair of cleft soft palate and excise accessory ear tag, right ear.

right ear.context: Cleft soft palate. Repair of cleft soft palate and excise accessory ear tag, right ear.

small piece of skin and cartilaginous ma.context: The right ear tag was examined first. This was a small piece of skin and cartilaginous material protruding just from the tragus.

protruding just from the tragus.context: The right ear tag was examined first. This was a small piece of skin and cartilaginous material protruding just from the tragus.

lesion.context: The right ear tag was examined first. This was a small piece of skin and cartilaginous material protruding just from the tragus. The lesion was excised and injected with 0.25% bupivacaine with epinephrine and then excised using an elliptical-style incision.

0.25% bupivacaine with epinephrine.context: The Dingman mouthgag was inserted and the palate was injected with 0.25% bupivacaine with epinephrine.

elliptical-style incision.context: The lesion was excised and injected with 0.25% bupivacaine with epinephrine and then excised using an elliptical-style incision.

cartilaginous attachment.context: Dissection was carried down the subcutaneous tissue to remove any cartilaginous attachment to the tragus.

Dingman mouthgag.context: The Dingman mouthgag was inserted and the palate was injected with 0.25% bupivacaine with epinephrine.

levator muscle.context: The anterior oral mucosa was lifted off and held demonstrating the underlying levator muscle.

Z-plasties.context: The Z-plasties were then designed, so there would be opposing Z-plasties from the nasal mucosa compared to the oral mucosa.

nasal mucosa.context: The Z-plasties were then designed, so there would be opposing Z-plasties from the nasal mucosa compared to the oral mucosa.

oral mucosa.context: The Z-plasties were then designed, so there would be opposing Z-plasties from the nasal mucosa compared to the oral mucosa.

uvula tissue.context: The remnant of the uvula tissue was found and was sutured in such a place that it would add some extra bulk to the nasal surface of the palate.

4-0 Vicryl.context: The nasal mucosa was sutured first using interrupted 4-0 Vicryl.

muscle.context: Next, the muscle was reapproximated using interrupted 4-0 Vicryl with an attempt to overlap the muscle in the midline.

open edges.context: The anterior and posterior open edges of the palatal were sewn together.

tolerated the procedure well.context: The patient tolerated the procedure well. Suction of blood and mucus performed at the end of the case. The patient tolerated the procedure well.

blood.context: The patient tolerated the procedure well. Suction of blood and mucus performed at the end of the case. The patient tolerated the procedure well.

mucus.context: The patient tolerated the procedure well. Suction of blood and mucus performed at the end of the case. The patient tolerated the procedure well.

in satisfactory condition.context: Disposition: In satisfactory condition to recovery.
